intro: Adicea lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf adicea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Adicea lanceolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
